stimulus:
In this study, you will read text scenarios and make slider judgments about the situations which they describe. Here is an image of an example trial.


In the upcoming trials, please read the descriptions and give your answer by clicking on the slider. Please read each scenario description carefully, but we are interested in your intuitive judgment so no need to second-guess yourself.

You must make a slider judgment in each trial. You will not receive any feedback.


When you are ready to begin, press the start button.

A teacher, Mrs. Carter, is providing feedback on her student Lin's painting.
Mrs. Carter thinks Lin's painting is extremly impressive, and compliments Lin that the colors work really well together, and that she can see that Lin has put a lot of thought into the composition.

How impressive did Mrs. Carter think the student's painting was?

During a team meeting, Mark presents a well-researched project proposal.
Lisa thinks that the data Mark gathered and the way he presented it is slightly impressive.

How impressive did Lisa think Marks presentation was?

Sophie asks Daniel if he can call later tonight to and give her some advice.
Daniel wanted to help, but he was exhausted and felt he might fall asleep. He told Sophie this, and suggested they talk tomorrow instead.

How tired is Daniel?

Lisa noticed that her son's grades have dropped significantly, and is quite concerned about how this might affect his future. She meets with her son's teacher to discuss this.

How concerned is Lisa?

David observes that his colleague has been distant and less chatty than usual, making him extremely concerned whether everything is okay.

How concerned is David?

Sarah excitedly talks about a recent indie band concert she attended with her friend Mark, telling him that she loved every moment of it, and was happy she was to able to hear them live.
On the other hand, Mark couldn't get into the music, and thought the concert was boring, and told Sarah so.

How boring was the concert for Mark?

During a group project, Alex helps Jessica by clarifying some confusing instructions.
Jessica thanks Alex for taking the time to explain, and feels that he has been slightly helpful.

How helpful did Jessica find Alex's help?

Mike notices his colleague looking overwhelmed with work and is concerned that he is taking on too much. He expresses his worry to him during a coffee break.

How concerned is Mike?

Anna tells her professor that she needs a few extra days to complete an assignment, due to a family emergency.
The professor thinks it is understandable, and tells her to take the extra time she needs.

How understandable does the Professor think Anna's reasons are?

David observes that his colleague has been distant and less chatty than usual, making him concerned whether everything is okay.

How concerned is David?

During a tech demo, a developer showcases a new app.
The features that they have included are cutting-edge, and the investor thinks that it is impressive how the developer managed to pull this together in such a short time.

How impressive did the investor find the developer's work?

During a tech demo, a developer showcases a new app.
The features that they have included are cutting-edge, and the investor thinks that it is kind of impressive how the developer managed to pull this together in such a short time.

How impressive did the investor find the developer's work?

Rachel gives feedback on Michael's draft presentation.
Michael feels that the suggestions are helpful, and thanks Rachel for it.

How helpful did Michael find Rachel's feedback?

After a trip to an art museum, Emily talks about her favorite exhibits to David. She found the contemporary art section was fascinating saying that she could spend hours there.
David found the art boring and hard to understand, and told her so.

How boring were the exhibits for David?

Emma invites her friend Alex over for dinner and cooks a homemade meal. She tried a new recipe, and asks Alex if he likes it.
Alex thinks it is quite impressive, and compliments her on how the flavors come together nicely.

How impressive did Alex think Emma's cooking was?

A sales assistant helps Megan find the exact item she was looking for after searching through multiple aisles.
Feeling that they have been helpful, Megan thanks the assistant for their help finding the item.

How helpful did Michael find Rachel's feedback?

Emma invites her friend Alex over for dinner and cooks a homemade meal. She tried a new recipe, and asks Alex if he likes it.
Alex thinks it is impressive, and compliments her on how the flavors come together nicely.

How impressive did Alex think Emma's cooking was?

Claire is studying for an exam, but her younger siblings are playing noisily in the next room.
It is difficult to study with all the noise, and Claire asks them to be a bit quieter.

How difficult is it for Claire to study?

Sam apologizes to his coworker, Rachel for missing her call. He tells her that he was in a meeting and did not see it.
Rachel accepts the appology, thinking that it is extremly understandable as they often have back-to-back meetings.

How understandable does Rachel think Sam's reasons are?

Jo's manager shares her thoughts on a recent company webinar on productivity strategies, saying that she thought it was enlightening.
Jo thought it was boring, and that the content didn't really resonate with her. She shared this thought with her manager.

How boring was the webinar for Jo?

A sales assistant helps Megan find the exact item she was looking for after searching through multiple aisles.
Feeling that they have been quite helpful, Megan thanks the assistant for their help finding the item.

How helpful did Michael find Rachel's feedback?

Melissa's coworker shares their positive experience at a networking event, saying how he enjoyed the event and made some great connections.
Melissa struggled to find conversations that interested her, and found the event boring, and shared this experience with her colleague.

How boring was the networking event for Melissa?

Anna explains to Dan how she decided to postpone her vacation because she needs to save more money before she can go.
Dan thinks it is slightly understandable as budgeting is important.

How understandable does Dan think Anna's reasons are?

Amy asks her friend, Lisa, for some tips on baking bread.
The tips are very helpful, and Amy thanks Lisa for it.

How helpful did Amy find Lisa's tips?

Alex is attending a lecture, but a group of students nearby is talking loudly.
It is extremely difficult to listen to the lecture, so Alex asks them to be quieter.

How difficult is it for Alex to listen to the lecture?

Rachel notices that her friend has been looking stressed and overwhelmed with work, making her concerned about how he is handling everything.

How concerned is Rachel?

Ms. Johnson hands back graded essays to her student Jade.
Ms. Johnson thinks Jade's essay is very impressive, and compliments her.

How impressive did Ms. Johnson find the studen's essay?

Melissa's coworker shares their positive experience at a networking event, saying how he enjoyed the event and made some great connections.
Melissa struggled to find conversations that interested her, and found the event quite boring, and shared this experience with her colleague.

How boring was the networking event for Melissa?

Rachel notices that her friend has been looking stressed and overwhelmed with work, making her very concerned about how he is handling everything.

How concerned is Rachel?

John invites his friend Alex to a weekend camping trip, but Alex declines because he is tired, and needs some rest during the weekend.
John thinks that is understandable as he has been taking on a lot recently. He expresses his understanding, and suggests that they plan another trip later in the year.

How understandable does John think Alex's reasons are?

Claire is studying for an exam, but her younger siblings are playing noisily in the next room.
It is very difficult to study with all the noise, and Claire asks them to be a bit quieter.

How difficult is it for Claire to study?

After a trip to an art museum, Emily talks about her favorite exhibits to David. She found the contemporary art section was fascinating saying that she could spend hours there.
David found the art extremely boring and hard to understand, and told her so.

How boring were the exhibits for David?

Anna tells her professor that she needs a few extra days to complete an assignment, due to a family emergency.
The professor thinks it is quite understandable, and tells her to take the extra time she needs.

How understandable does the Professor think Anna's reasons are?

Sarah is interning at a company, and her boss, Mr. Thompson asks her to stay to finish up her report.
Sarah was feeling exhausted after the back-to-back meetings and was not sure she'd be at her best. She told Mr. Thompson this, and asked him if she could come in early tomorrow to finish it up instead.

How tired is Sarah?

Sarah excitedly talks about a recent indie band concert she attended with her friend Mark, telling him that she loved every moment of it, and was happy she was to able to hear them live.
On the other hand, Mark couldn't get into the music, and thought the concert was kind of boring, and told Sarah so.

How boring was the concert for Mark?

Jo's manager shares her thoughts on a recent company webinar on productivity strategies, saying that she thought it was enlightening.
Jo thought it was slightly boring, and that the content didn't really resonate with her. She shared this thought with her manager.

How boring was the webinar for Jo?

Mike notices his colleague looking overwhelmed with work and is kind of concerned that he is taking on too much. He expresses his worry to him during a coffee break.

How concerned is Mike?

Sarah is at a restaurant with friends, but the background music is too loud, making it quite difficult to talk. She asks the staff to turn the music down a little.

How difficult is it for Sarah to talk?

A traveler, Sam, asks an airport staff member where to find a particular gate.
Sam thanks the staff for pointing him in the right direction, and feels that they have been helpful.

How helpful did Sam find the staff's help?

Amy's boyfriend Jake wants to talk about their date this weekend.
Amy was feeling kind of exhausted. Amy told this to Jake, and asked if it would be okay to talk about it tomorrow instead.

How tired is Amy?

Ben's cousin Amy asks him if he's coming to their monthly family gathering that evening.
Ben wanted to, but was quite exhausted from work. He told Amy this, and told her that he'll catch up with everyone next time.

How tired is Ben?

Emily is slightly concerned that her classmate Dan hasn't been participating in class and seems really withdrawn. She brings this concern up during a class discussion.

How concerned is Emily?
